Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Add caniuse images via bitsofco.de to trusted image domains" (#9252) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

We are offering Blazor wrapper packages for different web APIs. There is a great service called caniuse.com that shows the availability of a particular API on different platforms. Ire Aderinokun offers a service that shows the caniuse.com status data and MDN compat data in a (static) image, e.g.:

https://caniuse.bitsofco.de/image/async-clipboard.png → https://res.cloudinary.com/ireaderinokun/image/upload/v1663850793397/caniuse-embed/all/async-clipboard.png

![](https://caniuse.bitsofco.de/image/async-clipboard.png)

Thus, I'd like to suggest adding either `caniuse.bitsofco.de` or the resolved version `res.cloudinary.com/ireaderinokun/*/caniuse-embed/all/*.png` to the allowlist.

### Repro Steps

Status image is currently not shown:

- https://www.nuget.org/packages/Thinktecture.Blazor.AsyncClipboard
- https://www.nuget.org/packages/Thinktecture.Blazor.WebShare

### Expected Behavior

Status image is shown.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: "Minimum NuGet Client Version" field is empty in package metadata preview" (#9519) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

When a package is uploaded specifying [`minClientVersion`](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/nuspec#minclientversion) metadata attribute it seems there is an attempt to surface the value in the confirmation page after package upload, but the value is not printed under the header.

### Repro Steps

1. Make a package with a valid value of `minClientVersion` metadata attribute (`6.0` for example).
2. Try uploading it through web UI.
3. Observe empty line after "Minimum NuGet Client Version" header under "Verify"

### Expected Behavior

An actual version displayed.

### Screenshots

![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/102933/69a4cb47-fd50-4f53-99aa-b40900ac8eb2)


### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feature]: Increase the page size of the V3 catalog" (#9146) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

Currently, the V3 catalog on NuGet.org has a page size of 550. This has served us well for many years but, as the protocol demands, the catalog is append only so the catalog `index.json` will only grow as the number of catalog leaves accumulates. To slow down the `index.json` growth rate we can increase the page size.

This will give us more time to plan a fully scalable solution (e.g. https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7787).

The downloads.v1.json file is over 100 MB and still parses fine but the difference here is that the catalog index.json may be downloaded much more frequently (to poll for catalog commits). A smaller file is better.

### The Elevator Pitch

We should add the ability to configure the page size. It's a .NET constant right now of 550. We should increase it to a larger size. The value of 1650 seems to be working just fine in DEV for several weeks

### Additional Context and Details

We have an internal discussion [on Teams](https://teams.microsoft.com/l/message/19:d10cd9192de2492986fba3baeea3093c@thread.skype/1652468991222?tenantId=72f988bf-86f1-41af-91ab-2d7cd011db47&groupId=ad34ac55-6785-4e7c-82c3-7ba405d30c3c&parentMessageId=1652468991222&teamName=NuGet&channelName=Server&createdTime=1652468991222).

The index.json size over time is here:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/174692360-048bc4e8-dc22-4a77-8acb-cc511f156bab.png)
(y = bytes, x = month)

We already have several jumbo pages from deprecations:
PageUrl | LeafCount | max_CommitTimestamp
-- | -- | --
https://api.nuget.org/v3/catalog0/page9598.json | 1728 | 2020-02-09 13:04:53.7647929
https://api.nuget.org/v3/catalog0/page10769.json | 1183 | 2020-08-20 19:28:36.8641381
https://api.nuget.org/v3/catalog0/page10770.json | 1134 | 2020-08-20 19:29:20.2945851
https://api.nuget.org/v3/catalog0/page12124.json | 997 | 2021-03-12 10:27:09.9984875
https://api.nuget.org/v3/catalog0/page10857.json | 839 | 2020-09-03 13:35:37.7371129

The change in index.json MoM (month over month) is here:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/174692474-68b819e8-9203-4ca1-b085-cd5e0c13eb69.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: 404 reason phrase is not properly returned for package unlist" (#9504) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

The reason phrase we configure in gallery for API 404 responses is clobbered by our default pretty 404 error page. As you can see this just has the default "Not found" here:
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/94054/ce926e92-58c5-40f1-84db-570b27494110)

It should be showing this string:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/912cd3bd73432f6edf8a9e20106d3cc635ca99df/src/NuGetGallery/Controllers/ApiController.cs#L876-L877

Other status codes like 400 work properly.

### Repro Steps

Try to unlist a package using `nuget.exe delete` that does not exist and check the error response. It just says "not found" not a full message.

It says `Response status code does not indicate success: 404 (Not Found).`

### Expected Behavior

It should say `"Response status code does not indicate success: 404 (A package with ID 'does-not-exist' and version '1.0.0' does not exist.)."`

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Table in README markdown looks ugly due to word wrap that breaks words" (#9518) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

1. Table in README markdown looks ugly if some column contains a long text due to word wrap that breaks words in other columns even inside the inline code block. Compare rendered tables: Nuget https://www.nuget.org/packages/GlobRegex vs Github https://github.com/dscheg/GlobRegex
Github markdown looks good even on narrow screens. CSS to fix issue:
```css
.readme-common .table {
  overflow: auto;
  display: block;
  word-break: normal;
}
```

2. It might be better to have a horizontal scroll and turn off word wrap inside multiline code blocks, because it seems such code is hard to read, given that there are no line numbers and display of hyphens: it is not always clear whether the EOL is in the code itself or word wraping has been applied. The same example links above. CSS to fix issue: `pre code { white-space: pre; }` instead of `pre code { white-space: pre-wrap; }`


### Repro Steps

Create readme for the package with:
1. Table with 3 columns with a long text inside the middle column
2. Multiple long lines inside multiline code block

### Expected Behavior

1. Table looks good even with long text in some column
2. Multiline code blocks are easy to read even with long lines

### Screenshots

![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/1962268/513789fc-7d62-452b-9a10-e2e6607af536)

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: [Admin UI] Show number of package versions that have been selected in the Admin Unlist UI" (#9517) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

When we have to unlist many package versions at once, we often need to break it up into smaller batches. Showing the number of package versions that have been selected in the bulk unlist UI would help me do a better job of batch-sizing.
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/82980589/2aacb376-6d0d-44c0-bc21-c5d442bcf831)

We could even add the ability to select the first 'X' <unlisted/listed> package versions to help with this.

### Repro Steps

1. Go to the Bulk Unlist UI in the Admin Panel
2. Enter names of packages you need to unlist
3. Scroll down

### Expected Behavior

1. Show how many package versions have been selected (possibly in the button text)
![image](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/assets/82980589/2aacb376-6d0d-44c0-bc21-c5d442bcf831)

2. Add the ability to select the first 'X' <unlisted/listed> package versions among those shown.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[2FA] Avoid new accounts coming to the Register page." (#9501) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
# Changes
* Add `noindex` for `Register` (signup) and `SignInNugetAccount` (LogOnNuGetAccount) to avoid displaying them on search engines
* `SignUp` (/users/account/signup) page now redirects to `Sign In`.
* `LegacyRegister` (/account/register) page now redirects to `Sign In`.
* `Register` POST endpoint redirects to `Sign In` when it has a password registration and 2FA enforcement flag is turned.

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/4768

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[ReleasePrep][2023.05.23]RI of dev into main" (#9515) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Enable PVP flow for Nuget.Client in .NET source-build" (#12633) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Contributes to https://github.com/dotnet/source-build/issues/3043

PVP flow is a method of flowing dependencies in source build that only overrides versions of packages that the repo has a declared dependency on in `Version.Details.xml`. This means that the package flow is closer to the Microsoft's way of building .NET.

To fully enable PVP flow, the repo project in the VMR will need to set `<PackageVersionPropsFlowType>DependenciesOnly</PackageVersionPropsFlowType>` once these changes flow in.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "FloatRange throws Argument null exception on previously valid constructor" (#12618) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet SDK

### Product Version

6.7.0-preview

### Worked before?

6.6

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

We are using the `FloatRange` in our code [as seen here](https://github.com/dotnet/templating/blob/9ad6c6fc78fbfe50f4327a84a79b0f0641f37bbe/src/Microsoft.TemplateEngine.Edge/Installers/NuGet/NugetApiPackageManager.cs#L212). Before the update we had no issues with this constructor, and later used to check for correct package versions. After the update, this constructor throws a `ArgumentNullException`.

We have a use case on the `dotnet new` CLI command line and some templates are currently (after preview 4) generating incorrectly.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGetAudit should cache VulnerabilityInfo data better" (#12632) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe, MSBuild.exe, NuGet.exe, Visual Studio Package Management UI, NuGet SDK

### Product Version

6.7

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

[The spec for NuGetAudit](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/blob/dev/proposed/2022/vulnerabilities-in-restore.md) proposed that the V3 protocol VulnerabilityInfo resource would have an `@updated` property, which clients can use for caching.

In order to get a first version of NuGetAudit out more quickly, using the `@updated` property was not implemented, so that NuGet uses its default caching policy, just like all other resources (registration, flat container, etc).

Correct caching should be implemented, so that vulnerability files that infrequently change do not need to be re-downloaded needlessly.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "ETW events should use default '/' instead of '_'" (#12631) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Manager Console

### Product Version

N/A

### Worked before?

N/A

### Impact

None

### Repro Steps & Context

There is an issue in performance tests, not sure if this impact any of NuGet telemetry monitors.

As per David Kean:
We should avoid converting event/property names in ETW provider
This is allocating a lot during solution close and other places where lots of events are being produced, which is causing GCs to occur in some runs, introducing noise. The statement that says ETW events can't have '/' seems to be incorrect, as Windows, VS & .NET all include events with '/'. Also stopped converting properties as these are raw strings.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Moving to the new .NET Foundation CLA service" (#68) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello everyone
The .NET Foundation is transitioning to a new CLA service and I'm posting here to let you know it's happening. Some background info:

The new CLA service is based off of https://github.com/microsoft/ContributorLicenseAgreement, except it uses the dotnet-policy-service app

- Current contributors do not need to sign the CLA again
- The CLA agreement itself is not changing
- As part of the install/configuration process, the following work items will be completed

1. Create a .github repo if it doesn't exist already
2. Install the dotnet-policy-service app
3. Create PRs for the platformcontext.xml and cla.yml files
4. Disable the existing CLA webhook
5. Push the PRs to enable the new CLA service

That's all there is to it. I'll update this issue once the work is complete

Thanks
Chris
.NET Foundation Operations team
